messages.msgSnippet: ... Once again, it seems best to ask Jeeves. (www.askjeeves.com) Try this: http://www-chaos.umd.edu/history/welcome.html All the Best, Gus
messages.messageBody:
> > >Does anyone happen to know of a good site on the history of China? 
 
Once again, it seems best to ask Jeeves. (www.askjeeves.com)
 
Try this: http://www-chaos.umd.edu/history/welcome.html
 
All the Best, Gus

messages.msgSnippet: You might wanna look in pbs.org.  I don t know if they ll have anything; but it might be a good place to look into.  Nova may have done something on China.
messages.messageBody:
You might wanna look in pbs.org. I don't know if they'll have anything; but

Have fun surfin'.
Marcy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] History of China
messages.msgSnippet: ... Hi Jodye: I am not sure how far back in history you want to go, but here are the sites we found while doing a little history report for our homeschooling
messages.messageBody:
> Date: Thu, 27 Apr 2000 09:24:29 EDT
> From: JodyeB1@...
>Subject: History of China
>
>Hi
>Does anyone happen to know of a good site on the history of China? My kids
>and I watched Inn Of The Sixth Happiness yesterday, and now they want to know
>more about the history of China, and particularly the practice of foot
>binding. Thanks.
>
>Jodye


Hi Jodye:

I am not sure how far back in history you want to go, but here are the
sites we found while doing a little history report for our homeschooling
group's "Ancient Games" day:

http://members.aol.com/Donnclass/Chinalife.html#XIA

http://hzdf.zjpta.net.cn/chinese_culture/culture.html

http://julen.net/ancient/

http://www.hyperhistory.com/online_n2/History_n2/a.html

http://asterius.com/china/

http://www.gio.gov.tw/info/culture/culture.html


Hope that you find what you need!

Olivia
